text: Return to Yahweh
Return to Yahweh your God, \add O\add* Israel,
for you have stumbled because of your sin.
Take words with you,
and return to Yahweh.
Say to him,
“Take away all guilt;
accept good, and we will offer
the fruit\f + \fr 14:2 \ft Hebrew uncertain \f* of our lips.
Assyria will not save us;
we will not ride on horses,\f + \fr 14:3 \ft Hebrew “horse” \f*
and we will say no more, “Our God,”
to the work of our hands
because in you \add the\add* fatherless child finds mercy.
I will heal their disloyalty;\f + \fr 14:4 \ft Or “backsliding” \f*
I will love them freely
because my anger has turned back
from them.\f + \fr 14:4 \ft Hebrew “him” \f*
I will be like the dew to Israel;
he will blossom like the lily plant,
and he will strike his roots like the \add trees of\add* Lebanon.
His new plant shoots will spread out;
his splendor will be like the olive tree,
and his scent like the \add trees of\add* Lebanon.
⸤They will again dwell⸥\f + \fr 14:7 \ft Literally “They shall return, they shall dwell” \f* in my\f + \fr 14:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* shadow;
they will grow grain
and they will blossom like the plant vine;
his fame \add will be\add* like the wine of Lebanon.
\add O\add* Ephraim, ⸤what have I to do⸥\f + \fr 14:8 \ft Literally “what for me” \f* with idols?
I myself have answered and looked after you.\f + \fr 14:8 \ft Hebrew “him” \f*
I am like a luxuriant cypress;
your fruit\f + \fr 14:8 \ft Or “your faithfulness” \f* comes from me.
Who \add is\add* wise that he can understand these \add things\add*?
Who is discerning that he knows them?
The ways of Yahweh \add are\add* right,
and \add the\add* righteous walk in them;
but transgressors stumble in them.
